js
Class Id<T>

java.lang.Object
  js.Disposable
      js.Id<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Index
public class Id<T>
extends Disposable

An opaque class to construct an ID which can be used as a field identifier that is globally or locally unique.

Author:
J.J.Liu (Jianjun Liu) at http://www.jscripter.org
JavaScript:
Opaque types can be resolved but no class objects for them can be generated into the target codes. Re-compilers must exit with error on the operations of accessing that kind of class objects.

Constructor Summary
  Id()
          Creates an ID that is globally unique.
  Id(Id<?> idx)
          Re-wraps the argument ID to the desired generic type.
protected Id(java.lang.String idx)
          The typical constructor to create an ID that is locally unique with a specified string value.

Constructor Detail

Id

protected Id(java.lang.String idx)

The typical constructor to create an ID that is locally unique with a specified string value.

Parameters:
idx - The argument string value that uniquely identifies the ID in the local context.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must replace this constructor with the specified string argument as field identifier.

Id

public Id(Id<?> idx)

Re-wraps the argument ID to the desired generic type.

Parameters:
idx - The argument ID of the original type.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must replace this constructor with the the argument ID.

Id

public Id()

Creates an ID that is globally unique.

Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must replace this constructor with a globally unique integer as a field identifier.
Method Detail

mid

public final Var.Mid mid()

Gets the member ID of the current ID instance.

Returns:
The member ID of the current ID instance.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must ignore the virtual invocation of this method, that is, replacing it with its current instance.

hashCode

public final int hashCode()

Gets the hash code of the current ID instance.

Overrides:
hashCode in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
The hash code of the current ID instance.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must replace the virtual invocation of this method with the JavaScript expression converted from the Java static invocation: 
System.identityHashCode(this)
.

equals

public final boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)

Checks if the current ID instance equals another object.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
o - Any value
Returns:
true if the current ID instance equals o; false, otherwise.
Since:
1.0
JavaScript:
Re-compilers must replace the virtual invocation of this method with the JavaScript expression converted from the Java special invocation: 
super.equals(o)
.
